titleproper.value: Guide to the Doris Tobias Papers <num>MSS 265</num>

author.value: Collection processed by Jennifer E. Neal

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-07-31T20:57:16</date>

extent.value: in 1 record carton, 1 manuscript box, 1 half manuscript box, and 1 flat box

abstract.value: Doris Tobias (d. 2009) was a food writer based in New York City. She worked as a food and wine columnist and editor for <emph render="italic">Women's Wear Daily</emph> and <emph render="italic">Wine & Spirits Magazine</emph>. Tobias published several cook books and reviewed numerous restaurants during her career. This collection documents her professional career as a female writer involved in the food industry in New York City during the late 20th century. Materials include recipes, menus, print publications, clippings, food and wine event packets, business cards, financial and apartment contract records, writings, and a toy truck commemorating George Duboeuf's annual Beaujolais Nouveau.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Doris Tobias Papers; MSS 265; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.
Donated by David S. Feigin in 2009. The accession number associated with this gift is 2009.265.

Doris Tobias (d. 2009) was a food writer based in New York City. She worked as a food and wine columnist and editor for <emph render="italic">Women's Wear Daily</emph> and <emph render="italic">Wine & Spirits Magazine</emph>. Tobias published several cook books and reviewed numerous NYC restaurants during her career. In June 2008, she was interviewed about her 750 square foot East Village apartment for a New York Times article entitled, "LIVING IN A NUTSHELL; Living Large In Little Apple."

This collection documents Tobias' professional career as a female writer involved in the food industry in New York City during the late 20th century. Materials include recipes, menus, print publications, clippings, food and wine event packets, business cards, financial and apartment contract records, writings, and a toy truck commemorating George Duboeuf's annual Beaujolais Nouveau.

subject.value: Food habits -- New York (State) -- New York
